attributes.action: tackle knifepoint crime and to allow the public too protect themselves
attributes.additional_details: Too discuss to allow the general public too defend and protect themselves at knifepoint when walking in public/work, and too impose harder convictions on people carrying knifes that has been reported and ignored by the police.
attributes.background: To impose harder convictions for reported knife point crimes and too impose the policing response too potential crimes being committed instead of refusing too respond until an offence occurs.

rejection.details:
The decision to respond is an operational decision for the police, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

We've published the following petitions on increasing sentences for carrying a knife, which you may wish to sign: 

Introduce a minimum sentence for carrying a knife, equal to carrying a firearm: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300054

Introduce mandatory life sentence for possession of a knife: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318502
